slapmap.err.exisits: There is already an image named %d!
slapmap.err.exisits.tip: Try choosing a different name or deleting the other image by using: /slap delete %d.
slapmap.err.importerr: An error occurred while fetching or processing the image!
slapmap.err.importerr.tip: Are you sure that the URL is correct, or that your image is in a .png or .jpg format?
slapmap.help.head: Slapmap - Import images using a simple set of commands.
slapmap.help.importing.head: Importing Images Using Slapmap
slapmap.help.importing.line2: Load images from the internet (as long as it is .png or .jpg) onto an array of maps using the above syntax.
slapmap.help.importing.line3: If you would like to adjust the image, such as changing the width, height, or alignment, check out the adjusting page of the help command.
slapmap.help.adjusting.head: Changing Image Properties
slapmap.help.adjusting.line2: Adjust properties using the (optional) arguments above. Width and height take an integer in blocks, and alignment is a position on the item frame.
slapmap.help.adjusting.line3: Specifying both width and height will stretch the image, so if you want it to look nice, just choose either or.
slapmap.help.placing.head: Placing Images
slapmap.help.placing.line2: After importing an image, you are given a Slapstick. If you don't have one, use the above syntax to give one to yourself.
slapmap.help.placing.line3: Right click this stick wherever you want the array of maps to go. Maps can also be placed down directly without the need to worry about item frames.
slapmap.help.removing.head: Removing Images
slapmap.help.removing.line1: Arrays of maps can quickly be cleared by shift left-clicking a part of an image.
slapmap.help.removing.line2: A single map can be removed by clicking without shift.
slapmap.help.deleting.head: Deleting Images
